intro: Myosotis arvensis var. simplex, commonly known as the common forget-me-not, is a herbaceous annual plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with slender stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, sky-blue to violet flowers with five petals, which bloom from late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in fields, meadows, and along stream banks. Its flowers are known for their delicate appearance and are a common sight in naturalized areas.
